Package ro.tuc.tp.business

Interface IDeliveryServiceProcessing

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DeliveryService
    public interface IDeliveryServiceProcessing
    Interface that describes the methods that will be implemented for the admin and client

    • Method Detail

      • importItem

        void importItem()
        The method that imports the products from the csv file
        Post conditions
        !itemCollection.isEmpty()

      • addProduct

        void addProduct​(MenuItem item)
        Adds a new item as a base product in the products list
        Parameters:
        item - the base product that will be added to the product list
        Pre conditions
        item!=null
        Post conditions
        getSize() == getSize()@pre + 1

      • deleteProduct

        void deleteProduct​(MenuItem item)
        Method that delete a base product from the list with products
        Parameters:
        item - the product to be deleted
        Pre conditions
        !item.isEmpty()
        Post conditions
        getSize() == getSize()@pre - 1

      • editProduct

        void editProduct​(MenuItem oldItem,
                 MenuItem newItem)
        Method that updates a product
        Parameters:
        oldItem - the product which that will be edited
        newItem - the new product edited
        Pre conditions
        oldItem != null;, newItem != null;

      • getRaportA

        java.util.List<Order> getRaportA​(int startHour,
                                 int endHour)
        Method that generate the data for the first report
        Parameters:
        startHour - the start hour for order
        endHour - the end hour for order
        Returns:
        list with the order that was made between startHour and endHour
        Pre conditions
        startHour != 0, startHour != endHour, endHour != 24
        Post conditions
        afterCollection.size() == collectionMap.size();

      • getRaportB

        java.lang.String getRaportB​(int number)
        Method that generate the data for the second report
        Parameters:
        number - represent the number of times an product was ordered
        Returns:
        the products ordered more than the specified number as parameter
        Pre conditions
        number != 0

      • getRaportC

        java.lang.String getRaportC​(int number,
                            double value)
        Method that generate the data for the third report
        Parameters:
        number - the number of times
        value - the amount of the order
        Returns:
        the clients that have ordered more than the specified number as parameter and the value of the order was higher than the specified value
        Pre conditions
        number != 0, value != 0

      • getRaportD

        java.lang.String getRaportD​(java.time.DayOfWeek day)
        Method that generate the data for the fourth report
        Parameters:
        day - the day when the order was made
        Returns:
        the products ordered within a specified day with the number of times they have been ordered
        Pre conditions
        day != null

      • createOrder

        void createOrder​(java.lang.String idClient,
                 double totalPrice,
                 java.util.List<MenuItem> menuItemList)
        The method that creates an order
        Parameters:
        idClient - the customer who placed the order
        totalPrice - the total price of the order
        menuItemList - the list of ordered products
        Pre conditions
        idClient != null, totalPrice != 0, !menuItemList.isEmpty()
        Post conditions
        !collectionMap.isEmpty()

        Returns:
